summary: This document is an FBI 302 report detailing the process by which CDs seized from Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence in summer 2019 were copied and cataloged. A Special Agent (SA) and another agent (SA_) worked to copy the CDs onto FBI computers, create a folder structure based on the disc labels, and later upload the images into the Griffeye review software. The document lists specific government exhibits (GX numbers) that will be reviewed to confirm the source CD for each image.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: His New York residence was searched in summer 2019, leading to the seizure of CDs that are the subject of this document.

persons.name: SA_
persons.context: Another agent who assisted SA in copying the seized CDs and was later asked to upload the photos into the Griffeye software.

connections.description: Worked together to copy CDs seized from Jeffrey Epstein's residence and manage the digital evidence.
SA was involved in processing evidence seized from Epstein's New York residence.

events.title: Search of Epstein's NY Residence
events.description: Law enforcement searched Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence, resulting in the seizure of CDs.

events.title: CD Evidence Processing
events.description: FBI Special Agents SA and SA_ copied all CDs seized from Epstein's NY house onto computers in the FBI NY Office's lab, creating a folder structure based on disc labels.

locations: New York residence of Jeffrey Epstein
keyFacts: CDs containing images were seized from Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence during a search in summer 2019.
FBI agents created a detailed digital catalog of the seized CDs, saving images into folders named after the physical disc labels.
The images were later uploaded into Griffeye, an FBI software used for reviewing images.
The document lists numerous government exhibits (GX 304, 306, 307, etc.) that will be reviewed to trace specific images back to their source CDs.
